score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi network is performing well overall but has room for improvement.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload stayed the same, ping improved, networks improved.

latest_report.diagnosis: Your network experiences random dropouts which can be attributed to channel congestion and interference. Optimizing your channels may mitigate this.

performance.interpretation: Your download speed is excellent and within the expected range. Upload speed is slightly below optimal, and your ping is responsive.

problems: Interference from adjacent networks on overlapping channels.
Placement of router may limit coverage.
Inconsistent connectivity likely due to noise levels.
fixes: Change the 2.4GHz channel to 6, which is less congested (currently channel 11 has 2 networks).
Switch the 5GHz channel to 149; this channel has less congestion than 36.
Consider relocating your router closer to the center of your home for better coverage.
Disable unused devices or prioritize bandwidth for gaming activity if necessary.
Enable Band Steering to allow devices to connect to the best band automatically, reducing dropout incidents.
Regularly monitor and adjust channels based on current network conditions.
